title: Judges Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Judges chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Judges Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Judges Chapter 18.

questions.question: According to Judges 18:1, which tribe sought an inheritance to dwell in?
options: Danites
Judah
Ephraim
Zebulun
questions.correctAnswer: Danites
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1 states that the tribe of the Danites sought an inheritance to dwell in.

questions.question: How many men did the Danites send to spy out the land according to Judges 18:2?
options: Three
Five
Seven
Ten
questions.correctAnswer: Five
questions.explanation: Judges 18:2 tells us the Danites sent five men from their coasts to spy out the land.

questions.question: Who was the young man the Levite working for in Judges 18:4?
options: Micah
Jonathan
Gideon
Samson
questions.correctAnswer: Micah
questions.explanation: In Judges 18:4, the Levite says Micah has hired him and he is his priest.

questions.question: What did the priest say about the Danites’ way in Judges 18:6?
options: Go in peace: before the LORD is your way
Your way will be difficult and full of trials
You shall not prosper on this journey
Stay where you are and do not go
questions.correctAnswer: Go in peace: before the LORD is your way
questions.explanation: Judges 18:6 states the priest told them to go in peace because the LORD is before their way.

questions.question: According to Judges 18:7, what was notable about the people of Laish?
options: They dwelt careless and secure
They were at war with neighbors
They had a strong king
They lived in caves
questions.correctAnswer: They dwelt careless and secure
questions.explanation: The verse describes the people of Laish as dwelling careless, quiet, and secure.

questions.question: How many men from the tribe of Dan went up to possess the land according to Judges 18:11?
questions.explanation: Judges 18:11 states that six hundred men appointed with weapons of war went from the Danites.

questions.question: Where did the Danites pitch their camp before proceeding, as mentioned in Judges 18:12?
options: Kirjathjearim
Shiloh
Bethlehem
Hebron
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjathjearim
questions.explanation: Judges 18:12 states they pitched in Kirjathjearim, in Judah.

questions.question: What items did the five men find in Micah’s house according to Judges 18:14?
options: Ephod, teraphim, graven image, molten image
Ark of the Covenant, scrolls, torches, swords
Tables of stone, incense, altar, lampstand
Cups, bread, oil, and water
questions.correctAnswer: Ephod, teraphim, graven image, molten image
questions.explanation: Judges 18:14 lists these items present in Micah’s house.

questions.question: What did the men tell the priest to do when they took the idols from Micah's house in Judges 18:19?
options: Hold thy peace and be to us a father and a priest
Cry out to the people for help
Destroy the idols immediately
Return to Micah and ask forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Hold thy peace and be to us a father and a priest
questions.explanation: In Judges 18:19, they told the priest to hold his peace and come with them as their priest.

questions.question: True or False: Judges 18:23 records Micah confronting the Danites when they took away his gods and priest.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 18:23 shows Micah crying out to the Danites about what they had done.

questions.question: True or False: According to Judges 18:27, the Danites peacefully coexisted with the people of Laish after taking their city.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Judges 18:27 states that the Danites smote the people of Laish with the sword and burnt the city with fire.

questions.question: True or False: Judges 18:31 says the graven image made by Micah was set up while the house of God was in Shiloh.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 18:31 confirms the graven image was set up all the time the house of God was in Shiloh.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Judges 18:29: 'And they called the name of the city _______, after the name of Dan their father.'
options: Dan
Laish
Zorah
Eshtaol
questions.correctAnswer: Dan
questions.explanation: Judges 18:29 states that the city was called Dan after Dan their father.

questions.question: Who was Jonathan, mentioned in Judges 18:30?
options: Son of Gershom, the priest
King of Dan
Leader of the Danites
A prophet of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Son of Gershom, the priest
questions.explanation: Judges 18:30 identifies Jonathan as the son of Gershom, son of Manasseh, who was a priest for Dan.

questions.question: According to Judges 18:22-24, what was Micah's reaction when the Danites took away his gods and priest?
options: He was distressed and questioned them
He joined the Danites willingly
He attacked the Danites
He immediately called for help
questions.correctAnswer: He was distressed and questioned them
questions.explanation: Judges 18:24 records Micah expressing distress and questioning what they had done.

medium.title: Judges Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Judges Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 teach us about seeking God's guidance when making important decisions?
options: Ask counsel of a godly person or priest
Make decisions based on personal desires
Rely solely on the opinions of friends
Ignore spiritual advice and trust only yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Ask counsel of a godly person or priest
questions.explanation: In Judges 18:5-6, the Danite spies asked the Levite priest to seek God's counsel about their journey, demonstrating the importance of seeking divine guidance. This shows believers should seek God's direction in important decisions.

questions.question: A believer is facing uncertainty about a new opportunity. Based on Judges 18, what biblical truth would encourage them?
options: Trust that God will prosper your path if you follow Him
Avoid new opportunities to stay safe
Rely only on your own understanding
Wait passively for circumstances to change
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God will prosper your path if you follow Him
questions.explanation: Judges 18:6 states the priest told the spies, 'Go in peace: before the LORD is your way wherein ye go,' showing faith in God's providence brings peace and success in new endeavors.

questions.question: What does Judges 18 teach about integrity and honesty when the Danites take Micah's idols?
options: They took the idols secretly and forcefully, showing lack of integrity
They asked Micah's permission before taking the idols
They offered to pay for the idols
They returned the idols after realizing their mistake
questions.correctAnswer: They took the idols secretly and forcefully, showing lack of integrity
questions.explanation: Verses 17-20 describe how the Danites took Micah's graven image and priest without consent, highlighting a failure in honesty and respect, reminding believers to act with integrity and honor others' property.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 illustrate the importance of spiritual leadership within a community?
options: The Levite priest joined the Danites and became a leader for a whole tribe
The priest refused to leave Micah's house
The Danites had no priest and struggled spiritually
Micah's priesthood remained strong in his house
questions.correctAnswer: The Levite priest joined the Danites and became a leader for a whole tribe
questions.explanation: Judges 18:20 and 30 show the Levite priest left Micah and became priest for the tribe of Dan, emphasizing the influence spiritual leaders have and the importance of serving communities faithfully.

questions.question: In the context of Judges 18, what can we learn about the consequences of idolatry in family and church life?
options: Idolatry can negatively affect families and communities by leading them away from God
Idolatry strengthens a community spiritually
Idolatry has no impact on family relationships
Idolatry is acceptable if it brings peace
questions.correctAnswer: Idolatry can negatively affect families and communities by leading them away from God
questions.explanation: Verses 30-31 reveal that the Danites set up Micah's graven image even while the house of God was in Shiloh, showing how idolatry disrupts true worship and harms spiritual health in families and church.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise their values to fit in with a group. Based on Judges 18, what biblical principle would you share?
options: Stand firm in your convictions and avoid idolatry
Compromise to avoid conflict
Ignore spiritual warnings
Follow the crowd regardless
questions.correctAnswer: Stand firm in your convictions and avoid idolatry
questions.explanation: Judges 18 shows how the Danites compromised by taking idols and a priest not fully devoted to God, serving as a warning to believers to maintain faithfulness and reject idolatry or sinful conformity (Judges 18:20-31).

questions.question: What does Judges 18 teach about the importance of courage and initiative in accomplishing God's plans?
options: The Danites courageously took action to possess their inheritance
The Danites waited passively for others to act
They sought permission from all tribes before moving
They avoided conflict and stayed idle
questions.correctAnswer: The Danites courageously took action to possess their inheritance
questions.explanation: Judges 18:9-11 shows the Danites encouraging each other to rise and possess the land God promised, illustrating the need for boldness and initiative in fulfilling God's purposes.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 demonstrate the importance of prayer and seeking God’s approval before acting?
options: The Danite spies asked the Levite priest to inquire of God about their way
They acted without any spiritual consultation
They relied on their own strength and wisdom alone
They asked neighboring tribes for advice only
questions.correctAnswer: The Danite spies asked the Levite priest to inquire of God about their way
questions.explanation: Judges 18:5-6 records the spies requesting the priest to ask God if their journey would prosper, teaching believers to seek God's guidance through prayer before making decisions.

questions.question: True or False: Judges 18 shows that the Danites trusted God's promise and acted obediently to claim their inheritance.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Judges 18:9-10, the Danites encouraged one another to go and possess the land, trusting God had given it to them, showing faith and obedience in pursuing God's promise.

questions.question: True or False: The Levite priest in Judges 18 remained loyal to Micah and refused to join the Danites.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 19-20 show the priest was glad to join the Danites and left Micah's service, indicating a lack of loyalty to his initial employer and raising questions about spiritual integrity.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The Danites called the new city ______ after the name of their father, but it was originally called Laish.
options: Dan
Zorah
Eshtaol
Ephraim
questions.correctAnswer: Dan
questions.explanation: Judges 18:29 explains that after conquering Laish, the Danites renamed it Dan, honoring their ancestor, showing a biblical principle of remembering heritage while establishing new ground.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 illustrate the importance of stewardship and responsibility in leadership?
options: The Levite priest’s transfer to the Danites shows a lack of faithful stewardship
Micah’s priesthood continued faithfully without interruption
The Danites returned the idols responsibly
The Levite refused to serve any tribe
questions.correctAnswer: The Levite priest’s transfer to the Danites shows a lack of faithful stewardship
questions.explanation: Judges 18:20-26 describes how the priest left Micah’s house and joined the Danites, raising concerns about commitment and responsibility in spiritual leadership roles.

questions.question: What lesson about contentment and gratitude can be drawn from the Danites' actions in Judges 18?
options: They were dissatisfied and sought new land, showing a lack of contentment
They were content with their current inheritance
They thanked God openly for their possessions
They shared their land peacefully with others
questions.correctAnswer: They were dissatisfied and sought new land, showing a lack of contentment
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1-3 describes how the Danites sought an inheritance because they had not yet received their portion, indicating restlessness rather than contentment, teaching believers to trust God’s timing.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 encourage perseverance through trials and challenges in fulfilling God's plan?
options: The Danites persistently spied and prepared to take possession despite obstacles
They gave up after initial difficulties
They waited for others to act first
They avoided conflict and settled for less
questions.correctAnswer: The Danites persistently spied and prepared to take possession despite obstacles
questions.explanation: Judges 18:2-11 shows the Danites actively seeking and preparing to claim their inheritance, demonstrating perseverance and faithfulness despite challenges and uncertainty.

questions.question: According to Judges 18, what is a key danger when a community or family tolerates idolatry?
options: It leads to spiritual decline and disobedience to God's commands
It strengthens their relationship with God
It improves social peace
It has no real consequences
questions.correctAnswer: It leads to spiritual decline and disobedience to God's commands
questions.explanation: Verses 30-31 describe how the Danites set up Micah's idols, even with God's house in Shiloh, illustrating how idolatry causes spiritual downfall and disobedience.

hard.title: Judges Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Judges Chapter 18.

questions.question: What was the main reason the tribe of Dan sought a new inheritance to dwell in according to Judges 18?
options: Their original inheritance had not yet fallen to them among the tribes of Israel
They wanted to conquer new lands for expansion
They were commanded by God to relocate
Their land was destroyed by enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Their original inheritance had not yet fallen to them among the tribes of Israel
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1 states that the tribe of Dan sought an inheritance because their original inheritance had not yet fallen to them among the tribes of Israel.

questions.question: Who did the five men sent by the Danites meet at Mount Ephraim?
options: A young Levite who served as a priest for Micah
The king of Israel
A prophet of the Lord
The elders of the tribe of Ephraim
questions.correctAnswer: A young Levite who served as a priest for Micah
questions.explanation: Judges 18:3-4 shows that the five men met a young Levite who was Micah's priest.

questions.question: What did the five men ask the Levite to do before they proceeded with their plans?
options: Ask counsel of God about whether their way would be prosperous
Pray for victory over their enemies
Bless their weapons for battle
Call upon the elders for advice
questions.correctAnswer: Ask counsel of God about whether their way would be prosperous
questions.explanation: Judges 18:5 states that they asked the Levite to ask counsel of God to know if their way would be prosperous.

questions.question: How did the priest respond when asked about the success of their journey?
options: Go in peace, for the LORD has approved their way
Warned them of danger ahead
Told them to wait for a sign
Refused to give any counsel
questions.correctAnswer: Go in peace, for the LORD has approved their way
questions.explanation: Judges 18:6 says the priest told them to go in peace and that the LORD had approved their way.

questions.question: What was the condition of the people living in Laish as described by the spies?
options: They lived carelessly, quiet and secure, with no magistrate
They were militarized and vigilant
They were oppressed and poor
They were nomadic and frequently moved
questions.correctAnswer: They lived carelessly, quiet and secure, with no magistrate
questions.explanation: Judges 18:7 describes the people of Laish as living carelessly and securely without a magistrate.

questions.question: Where did the six hundred men of Dan first pitch their camp before advancing?
options: Kirjathjearim in Judah
Mount Ephraim
Laish
Zorah
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjathjearim in Judah
questions.explanation: Judges 18:12 states they camped at Kirjathjearim and called it Mahanehdan.

questions.question: What items did the Danite spies discover in Micah’s house?
options: An ephod, teraphim, a graven image, and a molten image
Only a graven image
The Ark of the Covenant
Sacred scrolls and altars
questions.correctAnswer: An ephod, teraphim, a graven image, and a molten image
questions.explanation: Judges 18:14 lists these idolatrous items found in Micah’s house.

questions.question: What role did the Levite priest accept when the Danites took the idols from Micah’s house?
options: He became their father and priest for the tribe of Dan
He refused to go with them
He was made king of Dan
He was taken prisoner
questions.correctAnswer: He became their father and priest for the tribe of Dan
questions.explanation: Judges 18:19-20 shows the priest was glad and accepted to be priest for the tribe of Dan.

questions.question: How did Micah respond when he confronted the Danites about taking his gods and priest?
options: He expressed sorrow and questioned what he had left
He called an army to fight them
He prayed to God for justice
He joined the Danites willingly
questions.correctAnswer: He expressed sorrow and questioned what he had left
questions.explanation: Judges 18:24 records Micah lamenting the loss of his gods and priest.

questions.question: What was the outcome when the Danites attacked Laish?
options: They struck down the people and burnt the city with fire
They were defeated and fled
They made peace and settled as allies
They were repelled by Laish’s army
questions.correctAnswer: They struck down the people and burnt the city with fire
questions.explanation: Judges 18:27 states the Danites smote the people and burnt the city.

questions.question: What new name did the Danites give to the city of Laish?
options: Dan
Mahanehdan
Kirjathjearim
Zorah
questions.correctAnswer: Dan
questions.explanation: Judges 18:29 explains the city was renamed Dan after their ancestor.

questions.question: Until when did Jonathan, son of Gershom, and his sons serve as priests for Dan?
options: Until the captivity of the land
Until the building of the temple
Until the judges ceased
Until the exile to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: Until the captivity of the land
questions.explanation: Judges 18:30 mentions Jonathan and his descendants were priests until the captivity.

questions.question: What is the significance of the presence of the ephod, teraphim, and graven images in the context of Israel's covenantal faithfulness?
options: They represent idolatry and deviation from exclusive worship of Yahweh
They are legitimate worship objects commanded by Moses
They symbolize Israel’s unity under one God
They are cultural artifacts with no religious meaning
questions.correctAnswer: They represent idolatry and deviation from exclusive worship of Yahweh
questions.explanation: The ephod and teraphim were often associated with unauthorized or idolatrous worship, violating God’s commands (Judges 18:14).

questions.question: True or False: The Danites consulted God through the Levite priest before attacking Laish, indicating they sought divine approval for their actions.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Judges 18:5-6 shows the Danites asked the Levite to seek God's counsel and he assured them their way was before the LORD.

questions.question: What does the narrative of Judges 18 reveal about the state of Israelite society during the period of the Judges?
options: There was no centralized leadership, resulting in tribal autonomy and idolatry
Israel was united under a strong monarchy
The Levites controlled all religious practices strictly
The tribes cooperated harmoniously with one another
questions.correctAnswer: There was no centralized leadership, resulting in tribal autonomy and idolatry
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1 and the whole chapter illustrate the lack of a king and the tribe acting independently, often leading to idolatrous practices.

questions.question: Which later biblical theme is foreshadowed by the Danites establishing their own priesthood and setting up graven images?
options: The division of the kingdom and religious apostasy
The coming of the Messiah
The exile and return
The rebuilding of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The division of the kingdom and religious apostasy
questions.explanation: The unauthorized priesthood and idolatry anticipate later divisions and apostasy seen in Israel and Judah (cf. 1 Kings 12).

theological.title: Judges Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Judges Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does the absence of a king in Israel during this period (Judges 18) signify about Israel's spiritual and political state?
options: A period of spiritual and political chaos
A time of great national unity
A peaceful and prosperous era
An era of prophetic leadership without kings
questions.correctAnswer: A period of spiritual and political chaos
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1 states 'In those days there was no king in Israel,' indicating a time of decentralized leadership and moral disorder. This theme aligns with Judges 17:6, Judges 21:25, 1 Samuel 8:7 (Israel's demand for a king due to their rejection of God’s kingship), Romans 3:10-18 (human sinfulness), and Proverbs 29:18 (lack of vision leads to chaos).

questions.question: What was the primary reason the tribe of Dan sought a new inheritance to dwell in?
options: Their original inheritance had not been fully received among the tribes of Israel
They wanted to expand their territory
They were fleeing from enemies
They sought a land with abundant resources
questions.correctAnswer: Their original inheritance had not been fully received among the tribes of Israel
questions.explanation: Judges 18:1 explains the Danites sought an inheritance because their portion had not fallen to them fully, reflecting a failure to possess God's promises. This echoes Numbers 32:12-13 (inheritance possession), Joshua 13-19 (land distribution), Hebrews 4:8-11 (rest and inheritance typology), and Psalm 37:29 (inheritance for the righteous).

questions.question: What role did the five men sent from Dan serve in the narrative?
options: Spies to search the land for a suitable inheritance
Priests to establish worship centers
Judges to lead the tribe in battle
Prophets to call the people to repentance
questions.correctAnswer: Spies to search the land for a suitable inheritance
questions.explanation: Judges 18:2 states that five men of valor were sent to spy out and search the land, a role similar to the spies in Numbers 13:1-33. This mission was to assess the land's suitability, reflecting themes of divine guidance (Proverbs 3:5-6), human responsibility (James 2:17), and God's promise to provide (Deuteronomy 1:21).

questions.question: How did the Levite describe his relationship with Micah in Judges 18?
options: He was hired by Micah and served as his priest
He was a prophet sent by God independently
He was a servant with no official role
He was a judge over the tribe of Dan
questions.correctAnswer: He was hired by Micah and served as his priest
questions.explanation: Judges 18:4 reveals the Levite's role as a hired priest for Micah, illustrating the corrupt priesthood and syncretistic worship prevalent in this era (cf. Judges 17:10). This contrasts with the divinely appointed priesthood in Exodus 28, Hebrews 7 (Christ as eternal priest), and Jeremiah 23:11 (false priests).

questions.question: What was the priest’s response when asked to inquire of God about the Danites' journey?
options: He assured them that their way was before the Lord and they could go in peace
He forbade them from going
He predicted disaster if they proceeded
He remained silent and gave no answer
questions.correctAnswer: He assured them that their way was before the Lord and they could go in peace
questions.explanation: Judges 18:6 records the Levite's assurance 'Go in peace: before the LORD is your way,' reflecting an invocation of divine approval. This resonates with Proverbs 16:9 (God directs steps), Psalm 37:23, Isaiah 30:21, and John 14:27 (peace from Christ). The answer also reflects human reliance on priestly counsel, though later events reveal ambiguity.

questions.question: How is the security of Laish described by the spies from Dan?
options: The people dwelt carelessly, quietly, and securely with no magistrate
It was a fortified city with many warriors
The people were constantly at war
It was a land of famine and desolation
questions.correctAnswer: The people dwelt carelessly, quietly, and securely with no magistrate
questions.explanation: Judges 18:7 states the people of Laish dwelt 'careless, after the manner of the Zidonians, quiet and secure; and there was no magistrate in the land.' This depicts a complacent society vulnerable to judgment, paralleling Isaiah 32:9-14 (warning to complacent cities), Proverbs 1:32, Romans 1:21, and Revelation 3:17-18 (lukewarmness).

questions.question: What significant religious objects were found in Micah’s house?
options: An ephod, teraphim, a graven image, and a molten image
The Ark of the Covenant and the tablets of stone
A golden calf and incense altar
A scroll of the Law and a menorah
questions.correctAnswer: An ephod, teraphim, a graven image, and a molten image
questions.explanation: Judges 18:14 and 18:17 mention these idolatrous objects, highlighting syncretism and departure from pure worship of Yahweh. This contrasts with Exodus 20:4-5 (prohibition of idols), Deuteronomy 27:15, 1 Corinthians 10:14, and Psalm 115:4-8 (idols are powerless).

questions.question: Why did the Danites persuade the Levite priest to join them?
options: To be their father and priest over a tribe and family in Israel
To lead them as a military commander
To curse their enemies
To write new laws for the tribe
questions.correctAnswer: To be their father and priest over a tribe and family in Israel
questions.explanation: Judges 18:19 shows the Danites offering a broader priestly role to the Levite, appealing to his ambition and desire for influence. This reflects the failure of centralized worship and priesthood (cf. 1 Samuel 2:12-17, Jeremiah 23:1-2, Hebrews 7:23-28, and the typology of Christ as perfect High Priest).

questions.question: What was the immediate consequence for Micah after the Danites took his idols and priest?
options: He was too weak to oppose them and returned home
He gathered his neighbors to retaliate and defeated the Danites
He appealed to the judges of Israel for justice
He joined the Danites willingly
questions.correctAnswer: He was too weak to oppose them and returned home
questions.explanation: Judges 18:26 describes Micah recognizing the Danites were too strong, so he turned back, showing human impotence against collective sin and violence. This theme is echoed in Habakkuk 1:2-4, Psalm 44:22, Romans 7:24, and Ecclesiastes 4:13.

questions.question: What was the fate of Laish after the Danites attacked?
options: They struck the city with the sword and burned it with fire
The city repelled the attack and remained intact
Laish formed an alliance with Dan
The city was abandoned before the attack
questions.correctAnswer: They struck the city with the sword and burned it with fire
questions.explanation: Judges 18:27 records the destruction of Laish by the Danites, illustrating the violent conquest and judgment motif consistent with Joshua 6 (Jericho), Deuteronomy 20:16, 1 Samuel 15:3, and Revelation 19:11-21 (divine judgment imagery).

questions.question: What new name did the Danites give to the city of Laish?
options: Dan
Mahanehdan
Kirjathjearim
Bethrehob
questions.correctAnswer: Dan
questions.explanation: Judges 18:29 states the city was called Dan after the tribe's ancestor, signifying tribal identity and settlement. This reflects the biblical pattern of naming places after tribal founders (Genesis 49:16-17, Joshua 19:47, 1 Chronicles 2:23-24, and Revelation 22:4-5 symbolizing God's people).

questions.question: What idolatrous practice did the tribe of Dan continue after settling in their new city?
options: They set up the graven image made by Micah
They destroyed all images and worshiped the true God only
They established a temple like Solomon's
They sent the images back to Micah’s house
questions.correctAnswer: They set up the graven image made by Micah
questions.explanation: Judges 18:30-31 narrate how the tribe of Dan continued idolatry by setting up Micah’s image, showing persistent syncretism and disobedience to God’s command (Exodus 20:4-5, Deuteronomy 12:2-3, Jeremiah 10:1-5, and Romans 1:22-25). This highlights human proclivity to idolatry despite divine revelation.

questions.question: Who served as priests to the tribe of Dan according to Judges 18?
options: Jonathan, son of Gershom, and his sons
Aaron and his descendants
Levites from Jerusalem
Samuel and his family
questions.correctAnswer: Jonathan, son of Gershom, and his sons
questions.explanation: Judges 18:30 identifies Jonathan, son of Gershom, and his sons as priests, indicating a deviation from the ordained priesthood of Aaron's lineage (Exodus 28:1, Numbers 3:10, 1 Samuel 2:12-17, and Hebrews 7:11-28), emphasizing religious disobedience and corruption.

questions.question: What does the presence of the ephod and teraphim in Micah's house indicate about religious practices in Israel at this time?
options: Syncretism and idolatry had infiltrated Israelite worship
Strict adherence to Mosaic law
Exclusive worship of Yahweh in the tabernacle
A prophetic revival movement
questions.correctAnswer: Syncretism and idolatry had infiltrated Israelite worship
questions.explanation: Judges 18:14-17 mention these objects, which are associated with divination and idol worship, showing Israel's departure from pure worship (cf. Hosea 4:12, Ezekiel 8:14-16, Deuteronomy 18:10-12, and 1 Corinthians 10:20). This highlights human sinfulness and the need for true repentance.

questions.question: What theological lesson can be drawn from the Levite's joy in joining the Danites and taking the idols with him?
options: Human ambition can lead to complicity in idolatry
True priesthood is only attained through divine calling
Joy always indicates God's approval
Idols can bring spiritual blessing if handled by priests
questions.correctAnswer: Human ambition can lead to complicity in idolatry
questions.explanation: Judges 18:19-20 shows the Levite's heart was glad to be priest over a tribe, despite idolatry, illustrating how human desires can corrupt religious roles (cf. 1 Timothy 3:1-7, Jude 1:11, Jeremiah 23:11, and James 4:1-4). True priesthood requires divine appointment and faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Judges 18 illustrate the consequences of Israel's failure to fully trust and obey God?
options: It led to idolatry, disunity, and violence among the tribes
It resulted in immediate divine judgment and exile
It caused Israel to become a united kingdom
It produced prophetic revival and repentance
questions.correctAnswer: It led to idolatry, disunity, and violence among the tribes
questions.explanation: The chapter reveals Danites seeking inheritance by force, stealing idols, and perpetuating idolatry (Judges 18:1-31). This reflects the consequences of disobedience (Deuteronomy 28), the cycle of sin in Judges 2:11-19, Romans 3:23 (all have sinned), and Galatians 5:19-21 (works of the flesh).
